thread.title: UVU soccer: Skyler Milne named WAC Offensive Player of the Week
thread.title_full: UVU soccer: Skyler Milne named WAC Offensive Player of the Week

title: UVU soccer: Skyler Milne named WAC Offensive Player of the Week
text:
Published: Monday, Oct. 19 2015 12:30 p.m. MDT Updated: 30 minutes ago Summary 
Utah Valley University's Skyler Milne and Seattle U's Shane Haworth have been named Western Athletic Conference Offensive and Defensive Players of the Week, respectively, for Oct. 12-18. 
Utah Valley University's Skyler Milne and Seattle U's Shane Haworth have been named Western Athletic Conference Offensive and Defensive Players of the Week, respectively, for Oct. 12 - 18. 
Milne recorded the first hat trick in Utah Valley men's soccer history on Friday, scoring all three goals in a 3-2 win over San José State. He scored his first two goals early in the first half to give the Wolverines the early lead. After the Spartans scored twice in the second half to tie the match at 2-2, he successfully converted a penalty kick opportunity in the 88th minute to give UVU the win. 
"Skyler has been a beast all year. He takes a pounding every match, yet he has a gift for the amazing," UVU head coach Greg Maas said. "I couldn't be more happy for him, and our entire team will take great pride in his honor." 
Milne, who is UVU's first offensive winner of the season, was also named to the College Soccer News National Team of the Week on Monday. The Wolverines are among the teams receiving votes in the College Soccer News Top 30 poll. 
Haworth recorded his 15th career shutout on Sunday against San José State, saving a penalty kick in the 52nd minute to preserve the 1-0 win. He also earned the win on Friday against CSU Bakersfield, making one save in a 3-1 win over the Roadrunners. 
Utah Valley takes its final road trip of the WAC regular season this weekend. The Wolverines play at Grand Canyon on Friday at 8:30 p.m. MT, and at UNLV at 2 p.m. MT on Sunday. Clint Burgi is the associate athletic director for communications and marketing at Utah Valley University. For more information on Wolverine athletics, visit WolverineGreen.com . Recommended Stories
